answers.answer: Hello,If you have completed the treatment and symptoms have subsided then chances of transmission of yeast infection are less. However sometimes yeast infection may recur. Various reasons for recurrent or persistent fungal infection are incomplete treatment, treatment resistance, co-existing dermatitis, diabetes and low immunity.It is very difficult to precisely confirm a diagnosis without examination and investigations and the answer is based on the medical information provided. For exact diagnosis, you are requested to consult your doctor. I sincerely hope that helps. Take care and please do keep me posted on how you are doing.

question: When can i start having sexual contact after treatment of metronidazole miconadole 5009/100g suppositorry?i was diagnose with candidiasis, but before we could know about it, i just had sex with my husband, it is possible that i may have passed it to him? and when can i start having sexual contact again? i am on my last night of the suppository but i still have this thin yellow discharge although the itch and other symptoms are gone.
title: i need help
